intro: Psathyrostachys rupestris subsp. dagestanica, commonly known as the Dagestan wild wheat, is a perennial grass native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, spikelet-bearing inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, dry habitats and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential in agricultural and genetic research. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other members of the species.
